caption: One of the most special memories I hold close to my heart happened right there, as I stood in awe of everything around me. I was with my kids, and nearby there was another group of children. That‚Äôs when I came up with an idea: ‚ÄúAlright, every time we cross a bridge, we‚Äôre going to make a wish. Close your eyes, and let‚Äôs wish for something special. Ready? 1, 2, 3.‚Äù We all closed our eyes as we crossed the bridge, and I added, ‚ÄúBut don‚Äôt say your wishes out loud, keep them secret!‚Äù The excitement was contagious‚Äîeveryone cheered, ‚ÄúYay!‚Äù and the joy of that moment became an unforgettable memory.ü•∞  It was such a beautiful experience to share with the kids. Moments like these remind me how important it is to never lose your inner child, to keep seeing the world with wonder, and to stay amazed by the little things. Building connections, creating memories, and cherishing them‚Äîthat‚Äôs what truly makes life extraordinary.  My trip was so much more meaningful because of those moments.‚ù£Ô∏è  The Pont Alexandre III is, without a doubt, one of the most beautiful bridges I‚Äôve ever seen. I was completely captivated by its beauty, its magic, and the romantic atmosphere that surrounds it. It‚Äôs a place that truly transports you and makes you feel like you‚Äôve stepped into a fairy tale.üßö‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è  Paris, with its charming streets, is simply unforgettable. A place that stays in your heart forever!

We have crossed this bridge many times admiring its beauty, however, on this occasion whilst walking along the river esplanade we got to see it from a different (looking up) angle, and under it, the workmanship is simply stunning

I wanted to celebrate the New Year in a different country & France it was! Landed in CDG New Year Eve at 10:30 PM. Arrived at the hotel at 11:40PM. Hotel attendant suggested I download the Bolt app (Lyft equivalent) the car ride service arrived within a min of the request. I was told to go to Pont Alexandre lll to get a glimpse of the fireworks & the Eiffel Tower. By 11:50 I was by the water & ready to countdown the year away into the new one. Happy 2025!

A Stunning Bridge with Unmatched Views  Pont Alexandre III is one of the most beautiful and iconic spots in Paris. The views from the bridge are absolutely breathtaking‚Äîyou can see the Eiffel Tower in one direction and the elegant Grand Palais in the other. It‚Äôs the perfect place to stop and admire the beauty of the city, especially at sunrise or sunset when the light makes everything feel magical.  The bridge itself is a masterpiece of design and history. Built for the 1900 Exposition Universelle, it‚Äôs full of intricate details, from the golden statues of Pegasus at each end to the ornate lamps and sculptures along its length. Every angle is worth a photo, and it‚Äôs easy to see why this spot is so beloved by locals and tourists alike.  Whether you‚Äôre taking a peaceful walk, capturing stunning photos, or just enjoying the views of the Seine and beyond, Pont Alexandre III is an unforgettable experience. It‚Äôs a place where Paris truly shines‚Äîdon‚Äôt miss it!
Watch my first photo shot by an old film camera. A beautiful bridge. Now used as a car, people bridge. There are many interesting statues on the bridge.
If you find yourself in Paris, don‚Äôt miss the chance to take a walk across this bridge! It‚Äôs one of the most beautiful in the city.

Possibly the most photoghraphed bridge over the river Seine, linking Invalides with Grand Palais. A walk along the river bank under the span gives a brilliant view of the ironwork used in the constuction and a close up of the ornate facade.
A good spot to snag some great photos of La Tour Eiffel as well as the Pont Alexandre III with its gold trimmings!  The bridge itself is beautiful and makes for a great backdrop in photos!
Stunning architecture. and engineering since it has been standing so long. it makes the area what it is.

My visit to Pont Alexandre III was truly memorable. This iconic bridge, renowned for its ornate design and intricate details, offers stunning views of the Seine River and surrounding landmarks. The beautiful sculptures and gilded statues, combined with the elegant lamp posts, create a picturesque setting that feels quintessentially Parisian. Strolling across the bridge, I admired the grand architecture of the nearby Grand Palais and Petit Palais, and enjoyed the lovely sight of the Eiffel Tower in the distance. It is a must-see for anyone visiting Paris, offering a perfect blend of history, art, and breathtaking views.
Numerous sculptors provided the¬†sculpture¬†that feature prominently on the bridge such as fames and nymphs.A lot of gold sculptures and I think this is the most beautiful bridge.
Iconic bridge crossing the Seine river that at the time of my visit was being used for Olympic purposes, which was very cool to see personally. Beautiful statues adorn the four posts.
Breathtaking views, perfect for a taking pictures with great background of the Eiffel Tower
Perhaps the most beautiful bridge in Paris. This is an iconic landmark in Paris.  Go near the river to take beautiful pictures of the bridge.

The Pont Alexandre III in Paris is a masterpiece of Belle √âpoque architecture, symbolizing Franco-Russian friendship. Its ornate design, with golden statues, intricate carvings, and art nouveau lamps, exudes elegance and grandeur. Spanning the Seine, it offers stunning views of the Eiffel Tower and Les Invalides. A stroll across this bridge, especially at sunset, feels magical, blending history, art, and romance. A must-visit for anyone exploring the charm of Paris!

Pont Alexandre III is the finish line for Paris 2024 races. Tr√®s incroyable backdrop with many cheering fans leading up to the bridge. It is perhaps the grandest bridge across the river Seine. Although not a long bridge in length, it is culturally important to the city of Paris.

A other must see tourist attraction in Paris. Such a beautiful and ornate bridge along with great views and photo opportunities of the Eiffel tower. Take a short walk from the Grand or Petite Palais. You won't regret it.
Very nice looking bridge, Napoleon's favorite - leading towards his grave at the military museum
It‚Äôs the most beautiful bridge in Paris. It‚Äôs half closed because of Paris Olympic preparations. But one side is open you can enjoy.

The most ornate bridge in Paris. We saw it from a river cruise, but I have also walked across. It was decorated for a big exposition and the lovely decorations, sculptures and lighting, remain to entertain us. Take a slow walk to admire it. You will also be in the midst of cultural institutions.

A Paris icon and a wonderful place to watch the Eiffel Tower sparkle.
One of the beautiful bridges in Paris France. Stunning architecture and craftsmanship

A beautiful bridge with ornate staues and iron work.

Very beautiful bridge, I love this bridge. So happy I got to come here with my best friend for some photoshoots. We got some nice angles to capture the bridge and the Eiffel tower. Highly recommended to visit this bridge if you ever come to Paris.

This bridge is just very pretty, the dark and gold contrast of its decoration is really nice. It has some sculptures on each corner and each end of the bridge.  From here you can take some river cruises on the Seine river as well.

Pont Alexandre III is the epitome of Parisian elegance, a bridge that's as much a work of art as it is a functional structure. Spanning the Seine River, it's adorned with ornate lamps, cherubs, nymphs, and gilded sculptures, making it a feast for the eyes. Strolling along this bridge feels like a journey through Belle √âpoque Paris. The view of the Eiffel Tower from the bridge is simply breathtaking. It's not just a bridge; it's a symbol of Paris's timeless charm and grandeur. üåâüá´üá∑üóº
Beautiful views no matter the time of year! The bridge is like a museum with different views of Paris! Highly recommend going in the morning or when the sun is setting!

Coming out of the Invalides train station, I stumbled upon the breathtaking Pont Alexandre III. Let me tell you, this bridge is not your ordinary way of crossing the Seine. It's an absolute masterpiece of art and architecture, offering some of the most stunning views in Paris, including the iconic Eiffel Tower.  Did you know that it was named after Tsar Alexander III of Russia? The bridge was inaugurated back in 1900 for the World's Fair and it's a testament to the friendship between France and Russia. The design of this bridge is just mind-blowing, featuring these four majestic statues representing Fame, Harmony, Charity, and Commerce. And let me tell you, these statues are adorned with gold leaf, crafted by the most renowned artists of that time, showcasing the exquisite Art Nouveau style.  As I was strolling along the bridge, I couldn't help but be captivated by the intricate details and the breathtaking panoramic views of the city. It's in such a perfect location, connecting the Invalides and Champs-Elys√©es districts, making it the ideal spot to take in the beauty of Paris. No wonder so many people choose this place for their engagement and wedding photos.  Let me tell you, the Pont Alexandre III isn't just your average bridge. It's a symbol of elegance and history. With a length of 828 meters, it's one of the longest and most ornate bridges in Paris. And let's not forget about those beautifully decorated lampposts and the intricate ironwork that adds to its charm. Trust me, if you're ever in Paris, you just can't miss it.  All in all, my experience at Pont Alexandre III was simply magical. It's a place where history, art, and breathtaking views come together to create an unforgettable experience.

Wide bridge over the Seine that if crosses moving south heads towards the Eiffel Tower, and if north, Champs Elysees. The bridge is decorated with numerous statues and is in my opinion the most impressive bridge in all of Paris.
Pont Alexandre III is one of the most beautiful bridge in Paris
One of the most impressive bridges of Paris over river Seine River. Especially impressive at night due to the lights and the magnificent view of surrounding places and the Eifel Tower.

A beautiful bridge built in the 1800s. The bridge has heavily decorated lamp posts on both sides and the entire bridge has touches of gold to its structure. This makes the bridge very majestically appealing. You will get a beautiful glimpse of the Seine river and a decent view of the Eiffel Tower.
Incredibly beutiful bridge about 25 minutes walking distant from the Eiffel tower. Great view of River Seine and Eiffel. Both day and night times have their own charm from this view point.

Pont Alexandre III is a marvel of engineering and beauty, spanning the Seine River in Paris with elegance and grace. Adorned with ornate sculptures, gilded decorations, and majestic lampposts, it is widely regarded as one of the most exquisite bridges in the world. Named after Tsar Alexander III, it symbolizes the Franco-Russian alliance and serves as a timeless monument to friendship and diplomacy. Strolling across Pont Alexandre III offers breathtaking views of the Seine and iconic Parisian landmarks, making it a must-see destination for visitors seeking romance, history, and architectural splendor.

Alexender Bridge is the most beautiful bridge of Paris connecting 2 major tourist attractions: Grand palace & Petit Palace on one side and Invalides on the other side. The lamps of bridge are stunning and the winged sculptures on bridge pillars worth checking out. Best place for photography during day and night both.
